text:
Eileen Carey is an American Country-Pop singer based in California. Carey is known for intersection of melodic music with pop arrangements. In 2017, Carey was awarded the National Radio Hits "Favorite Female Country Artist of the Year".
Career.
Eileen Carey was born in Cleveland, Ohio, where she spent her childhood and became an accomplished drummer. Later, she moved to California.
In 2002, she released her first album "Possibilities".
She released her fifth album "Let It Go", in 2014. It had eight songs. (This is not the same song as the "Let It Go" from the Disney film "Frozen", which came out in 2013.)
In 2017, Carey was named Live Country Music Performer of the Year at the Los Angeles Music Awards.
